body:
Looks like the to_prod tests are failing.
https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/d19f9cb4-503d-4d29-b408-a6b808f61941/targets/github%2Fgrpc/tests
Hmm, I don't understand why the interop tests keep failing, not just auth tests. Trying one more time.
I noticed only C-based languages are failing. @yang-g
It seems that adding --server_host_override= flag will fix the test but it shouldn't be needed.

@adelez  I think requiring server_host_override for some test could have to with stripping vs. non stripping  the port number from the JWT authority when performing auth.  CC @jiangtaoli2016 

I think if the host override is needed, then let's add it for now to make the tests green and investigate as a follow up.

While you are right you do not need the flag in this case on the wire, in some languages the flag is set to a default value to work with our test cert. I would suggest setting this flag to the same value as server_host to work around the problem. Otherwise you will need to change the default value of all the clients in various languages.
